result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adriano Lasica

Defendant Adriano Lasica not in court.  Attorney Peter John Heflin in court for Adriano Lasica.  
Attorney Katrina Voge in court for State of Wisconsin.

Status conference held.  Defendant's appearance is waived.  Atty. Heflin requests one more status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1. This hearing will be heard via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Heflin has received discovery and needs an offer, requesting a status date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. Defendant Adriano Lasica in court with attorney Peter John Heflin.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing held via Zoom. HEARING HELD OFF THE RECORD. Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Heflin has not received discovery or an offer and would like a status date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Adjustment Number: 22A 070108,
Payable Number: 1021920,
Receipt Number: 22RP029962,
Amount: $20.00

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07/14/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Adriano Lasica in court with Attorney Peter John Heflin.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 01.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Adriano Lasica not in court.  Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/09/2022@2p
